page.title: 01PADBURY AND HILLESDEN
page.content: The area contains the main street of the old village of Padbury in the northeast corner and the village of Hillesden on the western boundary. The land between consists almost entirely of farms, with a tributary of the Great Ouse flowing through from south to north. On the right bank of the river is Padbury Mill. In front of the mill is the site of an iron-age village,Norbury. Off the main street is "Old End" the site of the Anglo-saxon village.The old village school still stands but is now the Village Hall. Hillesden is also an ancient settlemet but now much smaller than Padbury. The magnificent church which dates from the 13th century crowns the scattered village. The school still stands but is now a private house.
